transformations.name: selectingfewcolumns
transformations.description: Creates an explicit mapping for each drifted column

typeProperties.script:
source(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false) ~> source1
source1 derive(director_name = toString(byName('director_name')),
		actor_1_name = toString(byName('actor_1_name')),
		movie_title = toString(byName('movie_title')),
		num_user_for_reviews = toString(byName('num_user_for_reviews')),
		imdb_score = toString(byName('imdb_score')),
		gross = toString(byName('gross')),
		title_year = toString(byName('title_year')),
		duration = toString(byName('duration')),
		num_voted_users = toString(byName('num_voted_users'))) ~> selectingfewcolumns
selectingfewcolumns filter(and(toInteger(gross)>=1000 , toInteger(title_year)==1998)) ~> Filter1
DerivedColumn1 sort(asc(gross, true)) ~> Sortbygross
Filter1 derive(imdb_score = iif(length({imdb_score})>0,imdb_score
,toString(0))) ~> DerivedColumn1
Sortbygross sink(input(
		movie_title as string,
		actor_name as string,
		director_name as string,
		gross as integer,
		duration as integer,
		num_critic_for_reviews as integer,
		num_voted_users as integer,
		release_year as integer,
		rating as integer
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	deletable:false,
	insertable:true,
	updateable:false,
	upsertable:false,
	truncate:true,
	format: 'table',
	postSQLs:['insert into movie_bkp\nselect * from movie'],
	mapColumn(
		movie_title,
		director_name
	)) ~> MovingSqlAzure
